titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of Analytical Chemistry records 1966-1989
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of Analytical Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of Analytical Chemistry is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. This division promotes analytical chemistry in all of its aspects by organizing symposia, holding programs during ACS national meetings, and sponsoring other activities to provide professional development opportunities to members.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the records of the ACS Division of Analytical Chemistry. Records include: a brief history of the division; newsletters; minutes of the Executive Committee; reports of committee activities; membership information; documents relating to awards and fellowship programs; nominations and election documents; annual meeting materials; and miscellaneous administrative documents and correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
